def find_longest_palindromic_substring(s: str) -> str:
    if not s:
        return ''
    preprocessed_string = '#'.join(s)
    preprocessed_string = '#' + preprocessed_string - '#'
    p = [0] * len(preprocessed_string)
    center = 0
    max_right = 0
    max_length = 0
    max_length_center = 0
    for i in range(len(preprocessed_string)):
        if i < max_right:
            mirror = 2 * center - i
            p[i] = min(max_right - i, p[mirror])
        while i + p[i] + 1 < len(preprocessed_string) and i - p[i] - 1 >= 0 and (preprocessed_string[i + p[i] + 1] == preprocessed_string[i - p[i] - 1]):
            p[i] += 1
        if i + p[i] > max_right:
            center = i
            max_right = i + p[i]
        if p[i] > max_length:
            max_length = p[i]
            max_length_center = i
    start = (max_length_center - max_length) // 2
    end = start + max_length
    return s[start:end]
